listicle_content.listicle: When India Today TV revisited the homes of the two toppers wondering if they will take the re-test, it was found that they were not home.
Ajay Singh, father of Saurav Shrestha who topped the Science stream, said his son has gone to Kota in Rajasthan to prepare for the medical exams.
\"My son has gone for an interview. As soon as gets a mode of conveyance, he will come back. If he doesn\'t, then we are helpless,\" he said as he stoon next to a car with an RJD flag.

It was the same story at Rubi Ray\'s house in Hajipur. When the Arts topper\'s grandfather Munshi Prasad was asked if she is taking the exam again, he said, \"I don\'t know... But she appeared for the first.\"
Rubi, who had shocked many when she told a local TV channel that one of her subjects was \'Prodical Science\' instead of political science, thinks the subject is about cooking.
Similarly, Saurabh Sresth did not have basic knowledge of science. He said aluminium is an active element in response to a question. But when asked about sodium and electrons, he failed to reply.
Interestingly, Rubi, like most students in Bihar, wants to become an IAS officer. Saurabh wants to become a scientist. Both Rubi and Saurabh are from the same college in Vaishali district.
The Bihar School Examination Control Board (BSECB) has stayed their results and asked the toppers in Science, Arts and Commerce streams to appear for interviews and written examination today.
The BSECB has said action will be taken against the toppers if they failed in the interview and their results too will be cancelled.
The Centre on Thursday sought a report from the Bihar government over the expose about the two \"dubious\" toppers, Minister of State for Human Resources Development Upendra Kushwaha said.

story.storykicker: It seems the Bihar board examination 'toppers' are not willing to take a fresh test as ordered by the administration.
story.storybody:
Days after the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar took cognisance of an India Today report exposing the two toppers of the state's Class XII examination knowing almost nothing about the disciplines they aced, it seems the duo is not willing to take a fresh test today as ordered by the administration.

As eyebrows were raised over the academic aptitude of the 'toppers' in Science and Arts streams, the authorities on Wednesday announced that their results have been put on hold. They were also ordered to appear before a team of experts for interview and written examination to re-test their academic calibre.

HERE ARE THE LATEST UPDATES:

{funfacts}
  1. When India Today TV revisited the homes of the two toppers wondering if they will take the re-test, it was found that they were not home.
  2. Ajay Singh, father of Saurav Shrestha who topped the Science stream, said his son has gone to Kota in Rajasthan to prepare for the medical exams.
  3. "My son has gone for an interview. As soon as gets a mode of conveyance, he will come back. If he doesn't, then we are helpless," he said as he stoon next to a car with an RJD flag.
  4. It was the same story at Rubi Ray's house in Hajipur. When the Arts topper's grandfather Munshi Prasad was asked if she is taking the exam again, he said, "I don't know... But she appeared for the first."
  5. Rubi, who had shocked many when she told a local TV channel that one of her subjects was 'Prodical Science' instead of political science, thinks the subject is about cooking.
  6. Similarly, Saurabh Sresth did not have basic knowledge of science. He said aluminium is an active element in response to a question. But when asked about sodium and electrons, he failed to reply.
  7. Interestingly, Rubi, like most students in Bihar, wants to become an IAS officer. Saurabh wants to become a scientist. Both Rubi and Saurabh are from the same college in Vaishali district.
  8. The Bihar School Examination Control Board (BSECB) has stayed their results and asked the toppers in Science, Arts and Commerce streams to appear for interviews and written examination today.
  9. The BSECB has said action will be taken against the toppers if they failed in the interview and their results too will be cancelled.
  10. The Centre on Thursday sought a report from the Bihar government over the expose about the two "dubious" toppers, Minister of State for Human Resources Development Upendra Kushwaha said.
{funfacts}
 

ALSO READ |  Clueless Bihar toppers unsure to sit for re-exam after India Today expose
